If we move UP, our new head would be (3,6). From there, the apple at (2,8) would be only 3 moves away (for example: (3,6) → (3,7) → (2,7) → (2,8)); however, note that our body occupies (2,6), so we’d need to work around that by going further up before shifting left.

On the other hand, if we move RIGHT our new head will be at (4,5). This move offers a relatively short and clear path to the apple at (6,4): from (4,5) we can go DOWN to (4,4) (which is free), then RIGHT to (5,4) and finally to (6,4), where the apple is waiting. The enemy snake (with head at (7,4)) is nearby, but our planned route avoids any collision, and we’ll be growing our snake by eating that apple.

After weighing both options, heading RIGHT seems the most direct and safe way to get a point and grow our snake.

Next move: RIGHT.
